--- title: Monitoring --- You can enable monitoring for applications in OpenShift Container Platform. ## Configure Monitoring and Metrics Monitoring https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/4.6/monitoring/enabling-monitoring-for-user-defined-projects.html#enabling-monitoring-for-user-defined-projects Metrics https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/4.6/monitoring/managing-metrics.html#managing-metrics ## 1. Create Config Map - Go to project: `openshift-monitoring` - Go to Config Maps and create a config map using the following YAML. - Set the enableUserWorkload setting to true under data/config.yaml - Save the file to apply the changes. YAML: ``` apiVersion: v1 kind: ConfigMap metadata: name: cluster-monitoring-config data: config.yaml: | enableUserWorkload: true ``` - $ oc -n openshift-user-workload-monitoring get pod ``` NAME READY STATUS RESTARTS AGE prometheus-operator-6f7b748d5b-t7nbg 2/2 Running 0 3h prometheus-user-workload-0 5/5 Running 1 3h prometheus-user-workload-1 5/5 Running 1 3h thanos-ruler-user-workload-0 3/3 Running 0 3h thanos-ruler-user-workload-1 3/3 Running 0 3h ``` ## 2. Create Service - Go to Manage project : `mas--manage` - Create service: `---monitoringagent` YAML sample: replace instanceid, workspaceid, and bundlename in the file below: ``` apiVersion: v1 kind: Service metadata: labels: app: -- name: ---monitoragent namespace: mas--manage spec: ports: - name: 9080-tcp protocol: TCP port: 9080 targetPort: 9080 - name: https protocol: TCP port: 9444 targetPort: 9444 selector: app: -- type: ClusterIP ``` ## 3. Create Service Monitor CRD (Custom Resource Definition) - Go to project: `mas-instanceid>-manage` - Create ServiceMonitor CRD: `---monitoragent` Sample YAML ``` apiVersion: monitoring.coreos.com/v1 kind: ServiceMonitor metadata: labels: k8s-app: ---monitoragent name: ---monitoragent namespace: mas--manage spec: endpoints: - interval: 1d port: 9080-tcp scheme: http selector: matchLabels: app: -- ``` ## Querying metrics - Go to Montoring->Metrics. The following Maximo queries are available:
Query Description
maximo_mbo_count Business object count
maximo_heap_memory_max_count Maximum heap
maximo_heap_memory_used_count Used heap
maximo_thread_pool_size Thread pool size
maximo_thread_deadlock Deadlock threads
maximo_thread_count Thread Count
maximo_thread_pool_active_count Thread pool active count
maximo_thread_pool_active_count Thread pool active count
maximo_thread_peak_count Thread pool peak count
maximo_db_connection_free_count Free number of DB connections
maximo_db_connection_used_count Used number of DB connections
maximo_db_connection_total_count Total number of DB connections
maximo_session_stats_active_count Count of active sessions
maximo_session_stats_live_count Count of live sessions
maximo_session_stats_create_count Count of session stats created on Liberty
- Click on the detail icon to get the list of queries: ![image](images/maxqueries.png)

- Sample Graph ![image](images/metrics.png) ## Garfana - Follow the link to setup Grafana - https://github.com/ibm-watson-iot/iot-docs/tree/master/monitoring#3-grafana-setup - Sample Dashboard ![image](images/grafana.png)
